[{'created': '2022-03-23 13:07:05.000000000', 'message': 'Format [keystone_authtoken] memcache_servers when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, the memcache_servers parameter should
be formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the proper format is applied even when hostnames
are used to define servers.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to wallaby:
This change covers novajoin which was already removed in master.

Backport note to victoria:
Resolved the conflicts caused by [1]. Also, Mistral and Zaqar are
additionally covered by this backport.

commit_message:
Format [keystone_authtoken] memcache_servers when IPv6 is used

When Memcached uses IPv6 network, the memcache_servers parameter should
be formatted as is described in the following example.
 inet6:[<host>]:<port>

This change ensures the proper format is applied even when hostnames
are used to define servers.

Also, this change fixes the timing to apply any2array. The function
should be applied before we check the first memcache server by [0],
otherwise the logic to detect IPv6 address does not work as intended.

Backport note to wallaby:
This change covers novajoin which was already removed in master.

Backport note to victoria:
 - Resolved the conflicts caused by [1]
 - Mistral and Zaqar are additionally covered by this backport
 - Fixed wrongly named spec file for zaqar::authtoken

[1] 34d78c5827be5b2410003dd76e7273159024650e

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/aodh/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/barbican/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/cinder/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/designate/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/glance/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/heat/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/ironic/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/ironic_inspector/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/manila/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/neutron/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/nova/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/novajoin/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/octavia/authtoken.pp
	manifests/profile/base/placement/authtoken.pp

commit_message:
Remove unused method from manila/utils

We currently do not use the write_data_to_file method
anymore, so there's not need for keeping it.

Partially-Implements: bp privsep-migration
Change-Id: Ibb626aea69083d77037730346bd517311e1638d4

[{'created': '2022-02-28 18:00:09.000000000', 'message': '[WIP][DNM] [L3][QoS] L3 agent QoS extension to handle duplicated FIPs

TODO: testing, documentation

The L3 agent QoS extension should be able to handle duplicated floating
IP addresses from different registers. Instead of using the IP address
as unique identifier, this patch proposes to store the (ID, IP address)
tuple. This tuple is unique per floating IP register and holds the
IP address, needed by the "tc" library to set the QoS rules.

Closes-Bug: #1962465
Change-Id: I3a09718c6e79fd1f37eb75264389c4e5043076a7

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] L3 agent QoS extension to handle duplicated FIPs

The L3 agent QoS extension should be able to handle duplicated floating
IP addresses from different registers. Those floating IP addresses can
be hosted in different networks and routers but the same compute node
and L3 agent.

Now, instead of using the IP address as unique identifier, this patch
stores the (ID, IP address) tuple. This tuple is unique per floating IP
register and holds the IP address, needed by the "tc" library to set
the QoS rules.

Closes-Bug: #1962465
Change-Id: I3a09718c6e79fd1f37eb75264389c4e5043076a7

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga

Change-Id: Ic853bb3a98d1cafba9304cf19ff2c4ecb1df1104

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- charm-helpers-sync

Change-Id: I27bba777156f162331b0be992d2eec4259b4d23f

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-04 07:45:02.000000000', 'message': "Expose block-device-allocate-retries and interval

The upstream has 3 min as the timeout (60 retries at 3-seconds
interval). It should work if an image is in a raw format to leverage
Ceph's copy-on-write or an image is small enough to be copied quickly.
However, there are some cases exeeding the 3 min deadline such as a big
enough image with Qcow2 or other formats like Windows images, or storage
backend doesn't have copy-on-write from Glance.

Let's bump the deadline to 15 min (300 retries at 3-seconds interval) to
cover most of the cases out of the box, and let operators tune it
further by exposing those options.

Co-authored-by: Mark Maglana <mark.maglana@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1758607
Change-Id: I6f6da8e90c6bbcd031ee183ae86d88eccd392230

commit_message:
Expose block-device-allocate-retries and interval

The upstream has 3 min as the timeout (60 retries at 3-seconds
interval). It should work if an image is in a raw format to leverage
Ceph's copy-on-write or an image is small enough to be copied quickly.
However, there are some cases exeeding the 3 min deadline such as a big
enough image with Qcow2 or other formats like Windows images, or storage
backend doesn't have copy-on-write from Glance.

Let's bump the deadline to 15 min (300 retries at 3-seconds interval) to
cover most of the cases out of the box, and let operators tune it
further by exposing those options.

Co-authored-by: Mark Maglana <mark.maglana@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1758607
Change-Id: I6f6da8e90c6bbcd031ee183ae86d88eccd392230
(cherry picked from commit 2283f12eddc45ab97701ece264391e545f6bda1c)

commit_message:
Expose reserved_host_disk_mb for nova.conf

The config is necessary to calculate available disk space for VMs with
disk-allocation-ratio which is already exposed as a charm option.

Closes-Bug: #1952184
Change-Id: I0ef55987517bded50f855e0dbc5e420cfbff4c1b
(cherry picked from commit a5dc16393ad94d9029a5de1605177d14f57f1af9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-14 23:24:00.000000000', 'message': 'More robust fix to trunk deletion race condition

When a VM is rebooted and it has a port in a trunk with DPDK and
vhostuserclient mode, Nova will delete the OVS port and then recreate it
when the VM reboots. This quick transition can create a race condition
between the trunk addition and deletion, causing the former to fail
because the latter deletes the trunk bridge. In this change we add
a dictionary to track trunks pending to be created, so the trunk
deletion can back off and not delete the bridge when a creation for the
same trunk arrives concurrently. This change also removes the wait
introduced by [1] and [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/714783
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/827580

Change-Id: I10f85237926d1fc5ded7411fc11088c9f0651478
Partial-Bug: #1869244
'}, {'created': '2022-02-16 00:30:46.000000000', 'message': 'More robust fix to trunk deletion race condition

commit_message:
More robust fix to trunk deletion race condition

When a VM is rebooted and it has a port in a trunk with DPDK and
vhostuserclient mode, Nova will delete the OVS port and then recreate it
when the VM reboots. This quick transition can create a race condition
between the trunk addition and deletion, causing the former to fail
because the latter deletes the trunk bridge. In this change we add
a dictionary to track trunks pending to be created, so the trunk
deletion can back off and not delete the bridge when a creation for the
same trunk arrives concurrently. This change also removes the wait
introduced by [1] and [2].

This change is associated to [3] on the os-vif side.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/714783
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/827580
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-vif/+/830103

Change-Id: I10f85237926d1fc5ded7411fc11088c9f0651478
Partial-Bug: #1869244

messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2022-04-07 15:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2022-04-07 15:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2022-04-07 18:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2022-04-07 18:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-07 15:44:20.000000000', 'message': "Pin Ara install deps

The old version of Ara used by d-g doesn't cap off dependencies which
are now no longer working together. We manually cap things off in our
Pip install step.

Note users should stop using this tool. There are alternatives like
zuul-jobs' ensure-devstack role [0] for Zuul/Ansible users. The issue is
that d-g is not very maintainable and on its last legs for the openstack
until the Xena release is no longer maintained. This is noted in the d-g

commit_message:
Pin Ara install deps

The old version of Ara used by d-g doesn't cap off dependencies which
are now no longer working together. We manually cap things off in our
Pip install step.

Note users should stop using this tool. There are alternatives like
zuul-jobs' ensure-devstack role [0] for Zuul/Ansible users. The issue is
that d-g is not very maintainable and on its last legs for the openstack
until the Xena release is no longer maintained. This is noted in the d-g
README.rst file.

[0] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-devstack

Story: 2009973
Change-Id: I781ce6e2be88d6724c6908490e17ba8acaa3b911

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-05 21:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent AttributeError when a conn is closed before calling getexpect

Seen in the wild:

  ERROR with Object server ... re: Trying to get commit status of PUT to ...:
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 417, in _get_conn_response
      self.app.node_timeout, not final_phase)
    File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 1634, in await_response
      self.resp = self.conn.getexpect()
    File ".../swift/common/bufferedhttp.py", line 229, in getexpect
      response = BufferedHTTPResponse(self.sock, **kwargs)
    File ".../swift/common/bufferedhttp.py", line 64, in __init__
      self._real_socket = sock.fd._sock
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'fd'

Trouble seems to be that the connection got closed (and so its sock was
set to None) before the spawned greenthread had a chance to actually
call getexpect.

Change-Id: I0420e94a0460f6bea1b82eebdee290b28f36ba71

'}]
commit_message:
Prevent AttributeError when a conn is closed before calling getexpect

Seen in the wild:

  ERROR with Object server ... re: Trying to get commit status of PUT to ...:
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 417, in _get_conn_response
      self.app.node_timeout, not final_phase)
    File ".../swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py", line 1634, in await_response
      self.resp = self.conn.getexpect()
    File ".../swift/common/bufferedhttp.py", line 229, in getexpect
      response = BufferedHTTPResponse(self.sock, **kwargs)
    File ".../swift/common/bufferedhttp.py", line 64, in __init__
      self._real_socket = sock.fd._sock
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'fd'

Trouble seems to be that the connection got closed (and so its sock was
set to None) before the spawned greenthread had a chance to actually
call getexpect.

Change-Id: I0420e94a0460f6bea1b82eebdee290b28f36ba71

commit_message:
Changing extension of the collections requirement file to .yml

The ansible-collections-requirements.yml was referred to as
ansible-collections-requirements.txt in the developer guide,
which caused failure of the relevant command.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie1b53393f51e5dd199333b9343bd5a7d2068c574

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- Remove overlay as no longer needed in charmhub with explicit .charm
- Pin setuptools < 50.0 in src/wheelhouse.txt

Change-Id: Ie15e3e0530345f488565454e673e40981f606bdd

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- pin setuptools < 50.0 in src/wheelhouse.txt

Change-Id: I8f8cfc878f3a47df3842d0541f1727864845ad67

commit_message:
Adapts new API response schema

This PR makes troveclient to handle API response in new data schema.
Trove API response data schema has changed by the commit[1].

Original problem is that python-troveclient can't parse a API response
data in new data schema, resulting in an error.

[1]: https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/429c39890e3242c6a502037673943b38452c5811

Task: 44986
Story: 2009979
Change-Id: Ia54628aa08af65f6ddc0c20b4199b9db92f85907

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- pin setuptools < 50.0 in src/wheelhouse.txt

Change-Id: I4a0495307796f1ea82029a4e5cbacffe364097f0

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I666cf87ca2e76cd8f70b27558d4b2cd03f4935e4

commit_message:
Set py_modules to empty list in setup.py

This prevents setuptools 61.0.0 doing autodiscovery and failing
as this is an ansible role, not a python module.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id0b18670847a78c55295c74a7070b580d90ffed0

messages:
[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2022-04-01 12:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2022-04-01 14:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/836180/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 46m 07s'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2022-04-04 12:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2022-04-05 11:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2022-04-07 14:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-01 12:47:13.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that re_added ports are DOWN before set back to UP

During e.g. rebuild of the server by Nova, ports plugged to such server
are quickly removed and added again into br-int. In such case, ports are
in the "re_added" ports set in the neutron-ovs-agent.
But it seems that in some cases it may happen that such port isn't
switched to be DOWN first and then, when neutron-ovs-agent treats port
as added/updated and reports to the server that port is UP, there is no
notification to nova-compute send (because port's status was UP and new
status is still UP in the Neutron DB).
As Nova waits for the notification from Neutron in such case server
could ends up in the ERROR state.

To avoid such issue, all ports which are treated as "re_added" by the
neutron-ovs-agent are now first switched to be DOWN on the server side.
That way, when those ports are treated as added/updated in the same
rpc_loop iteration, switching their status to UP will for sure trigger
notification to nova.

Closes-Bug: #1963899
Change-Id: I0df376a80140ead7ff1fbf7f5ffef08a999dbe0b
(cherry picked from commit e7edcec2608fe1cb30d7458a882eb81e058eb76e)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that re_added ports are DOWN before set back to UP

During e.g. rebuild of the server by Nova, ports plugged to such server
are quickly removed and added again into br-int. In such case, ports are
in the "re_added" ports set in the neutron-ovs-agent.
But it seems that in some cases it may happen that such port isn't
switched to be DOWN first and then, when neutron-ovs-agent treats port
as added/updated and reports to the server that port is UP, there is no
notification to nova-compute send (because port's status was UP and new
status is still UP in the Neutron DB).
As Nova waits for the notification from Neutron in such case server
could ends up in the ERROR state.

To avoid such issue, all ports which are treated as "re_added" by the
neutron-ovs-agent are now first switched to be DOWN on the server side.
That way, when those ports are treated as added/updated in the same
rpc_loop iteration, switching their status to UP will for sure trigger
notification to nova.

Closes-Bug: #1963899
Change-Id: I0df376a80140ead7ff1fbf7f5ffef08a999dbe0b
(cherry picked from commit e7edcec2608fe1cb30d7458a882eb81e058eb76e)

Ensure that re_added ports are DOWN before set back to UP

During e.g. rebuild of the server by Nova, ports plugged to such server
are quickly removed and added again into br-int. In such case, ports are
in the "re_added" ports set in the neutron-ovs-agent.
But it seems that in some cases it may happen that such port isn't
switched to be DOWN first and then, when neutron-ovs-agent treats port
as added/updated and reports to the server that port is UP, there is no
notification to nova-compute send (because port's status was UP and new
status is still UP in the Neutron DB).
As Nova waits for the notification from Neutron in such case server
could ends up in the ERROR state.

To avoid such issue, all ports which are treated as "re_added" by the
neutron-ovs-agent are now first switched to be DOWN on the server side.
That way, when those ports are treated as added/updated in the same
rpc_loop iteration, switching their status to UP will for sure trigger
notification to nova.

Ensure that re_added ports are DOWN before set back to UP

During e.g. rebuild of the server by Nova, ports plugged to such server
are quickly removed and added again into br-int. In such case, ports are
in the "re_added" ports set in the neutron-ovs-agent.
But it seems that in some cases it may happen that such port isn't
switched to be DOWN first and then, when neutron-ovs-agent treats port
as added/updated and reports to the server that port is UP, there is no
notification to nova-compute send (because port's status was UP and new
status is still UP in the Neutron DB).
As Nova waits for the notification from Neutron in such case server
could ends up in the ERROR state.

To avoid such issue, all ports which are treated as "re_added" by the
neutron-ovs-agent are now first switched to be DOWN on the server side.
That way, when those ports are treated as added/updated in the same

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-06 10:54:48.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Pin OVS version for OVN master

According to [1], the need version of job using OVN
master is just used in job networking-ovn-rally-task
is 91e1ff5dde396fbcc8623ac0726066e970e6de15

commit_message:
[OVN] Pin OVS version for OVN master

According to [1], the need version of job using OVN
master is just used in job networking-ovn-rally-task
is 91e1ff5dde396fbcc8623ac0726066e970e6de15

[1] https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/commit/576491f50721748ddfb2541ad1ef793ed9cba69d

Related-Bug: #1967472
Change-Id: I9b3c7812d553285a39dafd7c3777810e8a6e34f8

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- charmhelpers sync

Change-Id: Ie37826e7803659f2f40eaac5f8d539cce5ef145b

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga

Change-Id: Ideb0b18808ef8ccd17ee8e6c8cb399b3e9798ecc

commit_message:
Removing coverchange job

In retrospect this job provided very little value for
the short time it was functioning and none afterward.

Therefore I would argue for it's removal.

Conflicts:
   .zuul.yaml - due to the centos 9 jobs not being introduced in stable/1.6

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I326e06fe5918a5de7183f246dc850ec89b585ed2
(cherry picked from commit c6003f2ae14844a5fb1097c879f363a458ad949b)

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga
- charmhelpers sync

Change-Id: I9e03f8032c4e66586feec2bbf5f07e93b89355cc

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id43a695bf93809ba395ea6928aad1ddab32e4aac

commit_message:
fix 'huawei dorado v6' create new volume from snapshot error

change the luncopy mode,in dorado v6 we use clone_pair
modified some interface to call dorado v6

Closes-Bug: #1942342
Change-Id: If26ebd6a94512b1d8ecc1b786f518f667fc19ffe
(cherry picked from commit 77da18785af7bede26d3478934864e293c6f4ef6)

subject: [StableOnly] Reset eventlet hub after patching
messages:
[{'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2020-11-02 07:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-11-02 09:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello,

First thanks for this backport.

Few remarks about this:
- master should be merged first maybe you could add a depends-on (on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/755245/) to ensure to merge things in order.
- the cherry-pick comment is missing (from wallaby)(git cherry-pick -x <sha>)

For your other patches on ussuri, train, etc... please can you apply the same logic, namely, cherry-pick the changes from the parent branch in order (wallaby => victoria and then victoria => ussuri etc...) to keep the entire path of backports in our project history, and also please add a `depends-on` (who refer to the parent patch) to merge in order.'}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2020-11-02 10:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2020-11-02 10:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-16 10:40:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's wait for the patch to land on master before considering backports"}, {'account_id': 12907, 'date': '2021-04-27 14:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Please restore. This is the newest stable branch this change is good for. It is not needed on master any more. Thus the depends-on also needs to be removed.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-04-27 16:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-04-05 09:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-04-05 09:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2022-04-05 13:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-04-05 15:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-04-07 10:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
[StableOnly] Reset eventlet hub after patching

Patching the eventlet hub by setting the environment variable will not be
effective if hub singleton was already set by some imported module.
Calling `use_hub()` will reset it's value based on the current overrides.

Change-Id: Ida6756b50266b4b2b2545f82e03e83e1c3be1e9e
Closes-Bug: #1897877

commit_message:
Fix up upgrade order

Correct a faulty comparison between the neutron-gateway
and ovn-chassis charms. The latter is a subordinate
charm. Bring up ovn-dedicated-chassis from the bottom
of the list.

Place nova-compute directly after ovn-central to
reduce OVN control plane downtime. Add an explanatory
admonishment.

Reflect all the above in both the upgrade-charms and
upgrade-openstack pages.

Due to the connection between this documentation and
internal testing, a comment will be added to an existing
zaza-openstack-tests ordering bug (GH #709) explaining
what was done here.

Drive-by: Implement a more efficient build invocation
          by taking advantage of multi-core systems in
          addition to only building changed files.

Related-Bug: #1960275
Change-Id: I18c65bfc333912a480e7942a06641fce3971834e

commit_message:
[StableOnly] Reset eventlet hub after patching

Patching the eventlet hub by setting the environment variable will not be
effective if hub singleton was already set by some imported module.
Calling `use_hub()` will reset it's value based on the current overrides.

Change-Id: Ida6756b50266b4b2b2545f82e03e83e1c3be1e9e
Closes-Bug: #1897877
(cherry picked from commit 7f75fc1d4e7116b954db8924374e39c9fa8d9f6e)
(cherry picked from commit 5b35903e145a0a1b8c64b7f4ba71fa98ea1d935b)

commit_message:
Update to build using charmcraft - xena batch

Batch to add building by charmcraft for the xena batch.
Supports just wallaby and xena in gate.

This patch currently requires the wallaby-proposed pocket
to get past the referenced bug.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-manila-ganesha/+/834934
Related-Bug: #1967895
Change-Id: I9fd75186e0e94ccf5a160597f98c1fd2373a2def

commit_message:
Switch PYTHON3 to YES by default

PYTHON3 was set to NO by default, all of OpenStack
is now using Python 3 so this change moves the default.

Change-Id: I89d39f792e6de8ec85bfe75d7d0573f2269b8c8a

commit_message:
Add ceph mgr capabilities

Without this change, manila's cephfs driver results in
manilaclient.common.apiclient.exceptions.Forbidden:
Access was denied to this resource. (HTTP 403)
when running rados commands.

http://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/mgr/administrator/#client-authentication

This also picks up the zaza-openstack-tests fix for test share creation
resulting in 'no valid host'.

Closes-Bug: #1952763
Closes-Bug: #1962204
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-manila-ganesha/+/835859
Change-Id: I6ad5047fff2f3109a9efe1f03a786ce0412b4161
(cherry picked from commit 496bfd569b000bdaa7d16b61afdb069ec959c076)

mappings for Ussuri->Yoga.

commit_message:
Use hacluster.add_location()

This change removes the workaround that was needed when the hacluster
interface didn't have a method to define colocations.

Related-Bug: #1880644
Change-Id: I4236cb4784062807d53381380d9d161ce2f450ee
(cherry picked from commit f2d9ed37090607676c5c6b54ea797c55e228d2af)

commit_message:
Centos8 wallaby jobs teardown - deployment image build jobs

Per the topic branch [1] and discussed at [2] this removes the
centos8 buildimage* jobs from running on stable/wallaby branch.

Some jobs are removed completely as they are specific to wallaby
and centos8 (tripleo-buildimage-ironic-python-agent-centos-8-wallaby).
The tripleo-buildimage-overcloud-hardened-uefi-full-centos-8 is moved
to deprecated for now as it is still used by DIB.

As discussed during reviews this keeps overcloud-full and IPA
for C8 wallaby for now - they may be removed by a subsequent patch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:c8_wallaby_teardown
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-February/027403.html

Change-Id: I04526b2c7f90ab9399fb92c86a0da216024acd30

commit_message:
Updates for jammy enablement

- charmcraft: build-on 20.04 -> run-on 20.04/22.04 [*archs]
- Refresh tox targets
- Drop impish bundles and OSCI testing
- Add jammy metadata

Change-Id: I2483b0e008aa7ab31a6033cb85491b5ad0730d1e

-1 just for the questions (for visibility):
1) how can we control the IDL is connected to a DB backup node?
2) when the metadata is created, it performs just one write. Do we improve the performance removing this write command?'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-09-23 14:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1
> 
> -1 just for the questions (for visibility):
> 1) how can we control the IDL is connected to a DB backup node?
You just point the ovsdb connection string to the backup node.

> 2) when the metadata is created, it performs just one write. Do we improve the performance removing this write command?

Removing the write doesn't improve performance, it's just that it is impossible to write to the backup since it is read-only. So removing the write is necessary to be able to use backup servers."}, {'account_id': 30200, 'date': '2021-12-17 02:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 15:57:57.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Make ovn metadata agent report optional

The patch introduces a read-only mode for the metadata agent. The pros
are that agent can connect to read-only OVN DBs reducing load from
leader OVN DB. This can help in large scale environments significantly.

The con is that metadata agent will not appear in the list of agents and
that agent must be deleted from the agent API manually when updating to
read-only mode.

Closes-bug: #1929578

Change-Id: Ia996ebee183975b38ca101ca78ee33854051f0a2
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-05-27 13:58:20.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Make ovn metadata agent report optional

commit_message:
ovn: Make ovn metadata agent report optional

The patch introduces a read-only mode for the metadata agent. The pros
are that agent can connect to read-only OVN DBs reducing load from
leader OVN DB. This can help in large scale environments significantly.

The con is that metadata agent will not appear in the list of agents and
that agent must be deleted from the agent API manually when updating to
read-only mode.

Closes-bug: #1929578

Change-Id: Ia996ebee183975b38ca101ca78ee33854051f0a2
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support varying namespace depth with image-serve

It's possible that nested namespaces are used.

Change-Id: I188e46ab5a01e4984e38621c8785fd6528bd4b90

commit_message:
Set user message on volume create failure

This patch is to log user message when volume creation from
source volume fails. This is only for _create_from_source_volume, and
other patches will be submitted later etc.

Change-Id: If0c2dc24261a4f83e289a8e78859405b1e101018
Partial-Bug: #1799159

commit_message:
Set user message on volume create failure

This patch is to log user message when volume creation from
snapshot fails. This is only for _create_from_snapshot, and
other patches will be submitted for _create_from_source_volume etc.

Change-Id: I7214b22a613ea378fc496e1a81f639f913b01aa9
Partial-Bug: #1799159

[{'created': '2022-04-07 12:50:08.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate ip to bridges

This patch aims to provide the operator
the ability to migrate ips ( if there are )
from the physical interface to the bridge.
This is pertinent for deployers that wants

as make use of the ips configured for other

commit_message:
Migrate ip to bridges

This patch aims to provide the operator
the ability to migrate ips ( if there are )
from the physical interface to the bridge.
This is pertinent for deployers that wants
to provide bridges to neutron-ovs as well
as make use of the ips configured for other
means.

As an example, image the interfaces being used
for provider networks has ips configured which are
used to accees the nodes in the cluster. Nowadays
if we set that interface to br-ex:<iface>, it will lost
connectivity. We should be able to migrate the ip
from <iface> to <bridge>.

Change-Id: I75b4262f9a9760b79f20f82a26a59e00b3790a84

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-18 07:42:45.000000000', 'message': 'Run control plane update first, next compute and cephstorage last

Make sure compute role nodes are updated after the entire control
plane has been updated even in composable role and cephstorage role
nodes are updated last.

In composable deployment the control plane is sliced up in controller,
database, messaging. Currently we only ensure that controller get
updated first, so messaging or networker for instance get updated after
compute.

This kind of disruption in the control plane can lead to unexpected
issue on the compute role. Furthermore they can be seen as false
positive as the compute role would be updated after the all the
Controller roles.

Change-Id: Ib3bf87510763edc86f2300e3b28708f6ef38ea18
(cherry picked from commit 265588950aa45537035dc53889de10fdf172fcfc)
'}]
commit_message:
Run control plane update first, next compute and cephstorage last

Make sure compute role nodes are updated after the entire control
plane has been updated even in composable role and cephstorage role
nodes are updated last.

In composable deployment the control plane is sliced up in controller,
database, messaging. Currently we only ensure that controller get
updated first, so messaging or networker for instance get updated after
compute.

This kind of disruption in the control plane can lead to unexpected
issue on the compute role. Furthermore they can be seen as false
positive as the compute role would be updated after the all the
Controller roles.

Change-Id: Ib3bf87510763edc86f2300e3b28708f6ef38ea18
(cherry picked from commit 265588950aa45537035dc53889de10fdf172fcfc)

[{'created': '2020-11-02 07:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Reset eventlet hub after patching

Patching the eventlet hub by setting the environment variable will not be
effective if hub singleton was already set by some imported module.
Calling `use_hub()` will reset it's value based on the current overrides.

Closes-Bug: #1897877

commit_message:
[StableOnly] Reset eventlet hub after patching

Patching the eventlet hub by setting the environment variable will not be
effective if hub singleton was already set by some imported module.
Calling `use_hub()` will reset it's value based on the current overrides.

Change-Id: Ida6756b50266b4b2b2545f82e03e83e1c3be1e9e
Closes-Bug: #1897877

[{'created': '2022-03-17 15:35:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Ansible inventory generation when reusing group names

When a kolla-ansible group is composed of a kayobe group with the same
name and of at least one other kayobe group, kayobe would generate an
invalid Ansible inventory such as:

[compute:children]
controllers
compute

Because the top-level group should already be defined, we only need to
add as children the kayobe groups using different names.

commit_message:
Fix Ansible inventory generation when reusing group names

When a kolla-ansible group is composed of a kayobe group with the same
name and of at least one other kayobe group, kayobe would generate an
invalid Ansible inventory such as:

[compute:children]
controllers
compute

Because the top-level group should already be defined, we only need to
add as children the kayobe groups using different names.

Change-Id: I88bdf1e3d0c08271ac8938ae2f9ac3f9fee1efa5
Story: 2009927
Task: 44798

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain
needed to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this
mechanisms.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml
  lower-constraints.txt

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are due to the different zuul templates and
different lower constraints.

NOTE(stephenfin): Change Ibe9e1aa7501e80844ef4b4e05866c0c3cf310c86 is
squashed into this backport.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: Ia531606ec2526ce1c6169296a8f254342870416d
(cherry picked from commit a88653d07787d1ea29ce7bd05bf73db42db48c94)

Make sure compute role nodes are updated after the entire control
plane has been updated even in composable role and cephstorage role

commit_message:
Run control plane update first, next compute and cephstorage last

Make sure compute role nodes are updated after the entire control
plane has been updated even in composable role and cephstorage role
nodes are updated last.

In composable deployment the control plane is sliced up in controller,
database, messaging. Currently we only ensure that controller get
updated first, so messaging or networker for instance get updated after
compute.

This kind of disruption in the control plane can lead to unexpected
issue on the compute role. Furthermore they can be seen as false
positive as the compute role would be updated after the all the
Controller roles.

Change-Id: Ib3bf87510763edc86f2300e3b28708f6ef38ea18
(cherry picked from commit 265588950aa45537035dc53889de10fdf172fcfc)

commit_message:
Add ansible-collection-kolla to projects.yaml

This patch adds openstack/ansible-collection-kolla to zuul's project
configuration. The patch only adds official-openstack-repo-jobs
template which contains the github mirroring job [1] only.
ansible-collection-kolla does not need publish-to-pypi or other jobs.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L2831-L2845

Change-Id: I7871722be5704579a6203fd1fb71814c09591d76

commit_message:
Adds kolla_ansible_venv_ansible

This adds a variable that allows you to modify the version of ansible
installed in the kolla-ansible virtualenv. This is useful if you want
to use a customised version of ansible.

Change-Id: I319dd51ed3221826f820fbc0ae3639b89e9c82ea

commit_message:
Undercloud mysql database must be idempotent

Currently, the database backup excludes certain tables because it is
intended do a restorable dump of a Galera cluster, but this does not
apply onm the undercloud database, which does not belong to any cluster.

This patch changes the procedure for taking an undercloud database
backup to get a full one.

Change-Id: I5e2876b3f7ffe2b63584802505a10dd1966be4a0

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ic7f236b437c26773083e6a3528dc340bb78c18ec

commit_message:
Add ephemeral-heat option to infrared plugin spec

This change adds ephemeral-heat option to infrared plugin spec in
order to be able to override ephemeral_heat variable when running
tripleo-upgrade using infrared.

Change-Id: Ie8f801b3fea8e85cef7be409441f308afcc2856d

commit_message:
fix: Fix source port/port range

1. When the direction of the security group rule is egress, the following prompt should be the destination port/port range

Issue: 126898
Change-Id: I199fe1d9471c06eac1b00f2f0ec245d9dfb4177c

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-23 05:59:43.000000000', 'message': "POC/WIP - db: shard up the DatabaseBroker pending files

This is a quick first attempt at using more then one pending file per
database. Just to stop it from becoming a bottleneck when under load.

You can provide a pending_shards number and one will be selected at
random to append to. The file names are *.pending *-2.pending,
*n-pending.

This still needs tests and config plumbing from outside the DatabaseBroker,
but just put enough together so I can basically test it. Currently I'm
just changing the default.

Also move some of the locking around so we only have to lock the pending
shard and only do a container level lock when we're going to actually
merge_items. This seems to help with contention when working with
mulitple workers.

NOTE: there are debugging (import q; q()) statements still in this WIP
code. Mostly to pull out lock wait timings. Maybe these can be moved
into actual metrics.

Change-Id: Ib60e71340a4e3884a9a9d70891fe17a0490baa6b

"}, {'created': '2022-03-21 01:12:09.000000000', 'message': "db: shard up the DatabaseBroker pending files

When we get concurrent workers attempting to update the same container
or account DB there can be contention on locks, and with enough
connections can lead to timeouts. This happens for 2 reasons, there is
only 1 pending file and secondly we do a directory level lock when we
want to update it.
When the pending file gets big enough, also causing further locking and
potential contention as that single pending file needs to be locked and
commited into the database.

A pending file is a write ahead log. It allows us to quickly take, say a
container obj put, and write it without having to commit it to the
container database straight away.

Under concurrent load, a single pending file is just that a single file
and write locks to the file can cause current processes to queue up.

This patch reworks the locking and pending file semantics:

 1. Allow a configurable amount of pending files (shards) that processes
    can write to.
 2. Create a cycle/ring like structure of pending files so a process
    will attempt to write to a free pending file before it just has to
    wait.
 3. Lock the pending file with a write lock when we're writing to that
    particular file.
 4. Move the directory level lock to only occur when we need to commit
    the pending files into the DB.
 5. When more then one process sees that the pending files need to be
    commited. The first locks the container, any others will fall back
    to appending to a pending file.
 6. When commiting the pending files to the DB, only lock one at a time
    so futher incoming connections can still be appending to other
    pending files.
 7. When looking for pending files to commit, look and see what's in the
    directory and attempt to commit all it finds. The number of pending
    files is configurable. If reduced we don't want to loose any staged
    writes.

A new configuration option `pending_shards` is available and is the number
of pending files to use. The file names are *.pending *-2.pending, etc.

When testing this on my VSAIO, I had a script that would make 200 concurrent
container-server connections and write 20,000 objects. When I upped the
workers to 2, unsing the original code, I'd see alot of serverside timeouts.
With this code and setting the pending_shards to 5 or so (and increasing the
client timeout a little), I managed to get to
5 or 6 workers without getting a single server side timeout.

I did get some client side timeout especially above 6, but that's because
I'm saturating my poor virtual vagant SAIO.

Change-Id: Ib60e71340a4e3884a9a9d70891fe17a0490baa6b

commit_message:
db: shard up the DatabaseBroker pending files

When we get concurrent workers attempting to update the same container
or account DB there can be contention on locks, and with enough
connections can lead to timeouts. This happens for 2 reasons, there is
only 1 pending file and secondly we do a directory level lock when we
want to update it.
When the pending file gets big enough, also causing further locking and
potential contention as that single pending file needs to be locked and
commited into the database.

A pending file is a write ahead log. It allows us to quickly take, say a
container obj put, and write it without having to commit it to the
container database straight away.

Under concurrent load, a single pending file is just that a single file
and write locks to the file can cause current processes to queue up.

This patch reworks the locking and pending file semantics:

 1. Allow a configurable amount of pending files (shards) that processes
    can write to.
 2. Create a cycle/ring like structure of pending files so a process
    will attempt to write to a free pending file before it just has to
    wait.
 3. Lock the pending file with a write lock when we're writing to that
    particular file.
 4. Move the directory level lock to only occur when we need to commit
    the pending files into the DB.
 5. When more then one process sees that the pending files need to be
    commited. The first locks the container, any others will fall back
    to appending to a pending file.
 6. When commiting the pending files to the DB, only lock one at a time
    so futher incoming connections can still be appending to other
    pending files.
 7. When looking for pending files to commit, look and see what's in the
    directory and attempt to commit all it finds. The number of pending
    files is configurable. If reduced we don't want to loose any staged
    writes.

A new configuration option `pending_shards` is available and is the number
of pending files to use. The file names are *.pending *-2.pending, etc.

When testing this on my VSAIO, I had a script that would make 200 concurrent
container-server connections and write 20,000 objects. When I upped the
workers to 2, unsing the original code, I'd see alot of serverside timeouts.
With this code and setting the pending_shards to 5 or so (and increasing the
client timeout a little), I managed to get to
5 or 6 workers without getting a single server side timeout.

I did get some client side timeout especially above 6, but that's because
I'm saturating my poor virtual vagant SAIO.

Change-Id: Ib60e71340a4e3884a9a9d70891fe17a0490baa6b

"}, {'created': '2016-08-17 09:36:15.000000000', 'message': "Aspects event hooking

The first part of policy implementation is the mechanism to invoke
appropriate aspect methods on events in engine. Such events are
loading objects to the object store and loading packages.

Now it is possible:
* to write custom aspect code in the form of library package;
* to define the aspect rules in json-format and place it to the file
murano/common/aspects.py;
* aspects are notified of the objects load event and packages load
event;
* aspects can modify the values of object's properties.

The example policy enforces usage of some maximum instance flavor
and demonstrates hooking to the package load event.

Change-Id: Ic7c23af983392e8faf3055ee49dcf9581d516bbd
Partially-implements: bp application-policies
"}, {'created': '2016-08-17 09:43:24.000000000', 'message': "Aspects event hooking

* to define the aspect rules in json-format and place it to the file
murano/common/aspects.py;
* aspects are notified of the objects load event and packages load
event;
* aspects can modify the values of object's properties.

The example policy enforces usage of some maximum instance flavor
and demonstrates hooking to the package load event.

"}, {'created': '2016-08-29 15:58:06.000000000', 'message': "Initial commit for application policy

Commit includes:
* New package type Aspect which will have extended MuranoPL
  reflection capabilities. At this stage methods inside this type
  of packages have the ability to modify properties of any object
* New classes io.murano.policy.Aspect and io.murano.policy.Notifier
* Every aspect instance on its init subscribe to notifications of
  different events. For now it is only object initialization event.
  To subscribe, it passes itself, name of handler method and name
  of method to check some condition against the processed object
  to notifier's subscribe() method
* Example policy package that inforces usage of some maximum
  instance flavor with test-runner tests

So now it is possible:
* to write custom aspect code in the form of library package
* to define the aspect rules in json-format and place it to the file
  murano/common/aspects.py (until db tables and api are implemented)
* aspects are notified of the objects initializing event
* aspects can modify the values of object's properties

Change-Id: Ic7c23af983392e8faf3055ee49dcf9581d516bbd
Partially-implements: bp application-policies

commit_message:
Initial commit for application policy

Commit includes:
* New package type Aspect which will have extended MuranoPL
  reflection capabilities. At this stage methods inside this type
  of packages have the ability to modify properties of any object
* New classes io.murano.policy.Aspect and io.murano.policy.Notifier
* Every aspect instance can subscribe to notifications of
  different events. For now it is only object initialization event.
  To subscribe, it passes itself, name of handler method and name
  of method to check some condition against the processed object
  to notifier's subscribe() method
* Example policy package that inforces usage of some maximum
  instance flavor with test-runner based tests

So now it is possible:
* to write custom aspect code in the form of library package
* to define the aspect rules in json-format and place it to the file
  murano/common/aspects.py (until db tables and api are implemented)
* aspects are notified of the objects initializing event
* aspects can modify the values of object's properties

Change-Id: Ic7c23af983392e8faf3055ee49dcf9581d516bbd

commit_message:
Extended MuranoPL reflection and package load event

1. Methods inside Aspect packages provided with extended
   reflection capabilities:
     * changing type property default value
     * changing type property contract
     * changing method argument default value
     * changing method argument contract
2. Aspects are able to subscribe to package load event
3. DefaultSetter and ContractSetter example policies are added

Change-Id: I141b1f80b2b1e8aaf97d167734fefeeecdd72fed

commit_message:
Ability to add metadata with aspect through extended reflection

Now aspects are able to use method addMeta(metaclass, props)
to add new metadata to classes, properties, methods and arguments.

Change-Id: I3fd128b8a8618e8bc1a2384b989d955aa9dffcc5
Partially-implements: bp application-policies

commit_message:
Fix tox docs env to have the correct dependencies

Pip is pulling in unstrained dependencies during the "sibblings" package
install step. Normally this is fine as the dependencies have already been
installed and it's just installing the package under test. However, with
designate there are a lot of overlapping dependencies and pip will end up
reinstalling an unconstrained version. In this case it was Jinja2.

Change-Id: Ie49f99ba8e86913471ee6cd078f5afd28282c0f5
(cherry picked from commit 30a03e1092b29457e4b79c9c7e33f835f534c857)

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga

Change-Id: I3b35d399a2aa2656ba1aa45c54a398923582ef30

commit_message:
Fix tox docs env to have the correct dependencies

Pip is pulling in unstrained dependencies during the "sibblings" package
install step. Normally this is fine as the dependencies have already been
installed and it's just installing the package under test. However, with
designate there are a lot of overlapping dependencies and pip will end up
reinstalling an unconstrained version. In this case it was Jinja2.

Change-Id: Ie49f99ba8e86913471ee6cd078f5afd28282c0f5
(cherry picked from commit 08d56f871311464c7d8f3c1f0c56b2a7f9cd36e1)

commit_message:
Fix tox docs env to have the correct dependencies

Pip is pulling in unstrained dependencies during the "sibblings" package
install step. Normally this is fine as the dependencies have already been
installed and it's just installing the package under test. However, with
designate there are a lot of overlapping dependencies and pip will end up
reinstalling an unconstrained version. In this case it was Jinja2.

Change-Id: Ie49f99ba8e86913471ee6cd078f5afd28282c0f5
(cherry picked from commit 5b40d3d908ca674a8bc112397f008ebce0e0661c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 10:54:26.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt and move
them to a dedicated place.

Indeed, we need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Ibf838f01d935763ff1e0d19f10340c8ee360784c
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt and move
them to a dedicated place.

Indeed, we need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Ibf838f01d935763ff1e0d19f10340c8ee360784c

Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga

Change-Id: Ib993e07f73d694d9d0189dc55d6ab1e3c9d31938

commit_message:
Updates to enable jammy and finalise charmcraft builds

- Add 22.04 to charmcraft.yaml
- Update metadata to include jammy
- Remove impish from metadata
- Update osci.yaml to include py3.10 default job
- Modify tox.ini to remove py35,py36,py37 tox target and add py310
  target.
- ensure that the openstack-origin is yoga

Change-Id: Ia0cdf927a4d4d2339ca1739066bf9a965c97d190

commit_message:
Refactor migrate-ip function

This patch aims to refactor migrate-ip
function to migrate the ips of bridges
from src_nic instead of pci_id as well
as avoiding to recreate the bridge, if
doesn't exists, as a dpdk bridge.

Change-Id: I7c2e12d46012a7fd46bb61d1fdbf1423d54f5ffd

commit_message:
Deploy separate placement always

Older than train releases are not supported by gate already. So no
need to keep cases to deploy placement inside nova helmrelease.
Apart from that, changed the deployment order of nova and placement.

Change-Id: I03f303e8081207e15ecf8424039948305af3bb12

commit_message:
Fix setup.py and setup.cfg deprecations

This project cannot be "installed" as a python package,
so specify there are no "py_modules" to install; alongside,
hyphenated metadata headers are deprecated in setup.cfg, replace them.

Change-Id: I0713f3c871180ea235c12f888e43a7a823341f0c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

If local exclusions are not a subset of global exclusions, we probably
want to identify any item in local exclusions that are not in global
exclusions, instead of the opposite.

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 08:42:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ingress bandwidth limit in the openvswitch agent

For ingress bandwidth limiting openvswitch agent is using QoS and queues
from the Open vSwitch. There is always queue 0 used for that purpose.
Initially, when this feature was implemented, we assumed that queue 0 is
kind of the "default" queue to which all traffic will be send if there
are no other queues. But that's not true thus ingress bandwidth limiting
wasn't working properly with this agent.

This patch fixes that issue but adding in the table=0 of the br-int
additional OF rule to send all traffic to the queue 0.
In this queue for some ports there can be QoS configured
and then it will be applied for the port. If port don't have any QoS
configured, nothing will happen and all will work like before this
patch.

Biggest problem with that solution was the case when also ports with
minimum bandwidth are on the same node becuase such ports are using
different queues (queue number is the same as ofport number of the tap
interface).
In case when traffic is going from the port with minimum bandwidth QoS
to the port which has ingress bw limit configured, traffic is going only
through br-int and will use queue 0 to apply ingress bw limit properly.
In case when traffic from port with minimum bandwidth set needs to go
out from the host, it will always use physical bridge (minimum bandwidth
is only supported for the provider networks) and proper queue will be
set for such traffic in the physical bridge.
To be able to set proper queue in the physical bridge, this patch adds
additional OF rule to the br-int to set queue_num value in the pkt_mark
field [1] as this seems to be only field which can "survive" passing
bridges.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/ovs-fields.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1959567
Change-Id: I1e31565475f38c6ad817268699b165759ac05410
(cherry picked from commit f7ab90baad83823cfb94bc8b9450cd915ea49c03)
(cherry picked from commit 5573230d30a7beb242ab54eb85b8e36f33f79403)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ingress bandwidth limit in the openvswitch agent

For ingress bandwidth limiting openvswitch agent is using QoS and queues
from the Open vSwitch. There is always queue 0 used for that purpose.
Initially, when this feature was implemented, we assumed that queue 0 is
kind of the "default" queue to which all traffic will be send if there
are no other queues. But that's not true thus ingress bandwidth limiting
wasn't working properly with this agent.

This patch fixes that issue but adding in the table=0 of the br-int
additional OF rule to send all traffic to the queue 0.
In this queue for some ports there can be QoS configured
and then it will be applied for the port. If port don't have any QoS
configured, nothing will happen and all will work like before this
patch.

Biggest problem with that solution was the case when also ports with
minimum bandwidth are on the same node becuase such ports are using
different queues (queue number is the same as ofport number of the tap
interface).
In case when traffic is going from the port with minimum bandwidth QoS
to the port which has ingress bw limit configured, traffic is going only
through br-int and will use queue 0 to apply ingress bw limit properly.
In case when traffic from port with minimum bandwidth set needs to go
out from the host, it will always use physical bridge (minimum bandwidth
is only supported for the provider networks) and proper queue will be
set for such traffic in the physical bridge.
To be able to set proper queue in the physical bridge, this patch adds
additional OF rule to the br-int to set queue_num value in the pkt_mark
field [1] as this seems to be only field which can "survive" passing
bridges.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/ovs-fields.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1959567
Change-Id: I1e31565475f38c6ad817268699b165759ac05410
(cherry picked from commit f7ab90baad83823cfb94bc8b9450cd915ea49c03)
(cherry picked from commit 5573230d30a7beb242ab54eb85b8e36f33f79403)

commit_message:
Explicitly cast boolean variables in cephadm playbook

Depending on the ansible config it might happen that variables are
evaluated as string, resulting in a wrong tasks order execution.
This patch just cast to bool the global variables that drive the
cephadm playbook execution during the overcloud deployment stage.

Change-Id: Iad553cd115c4486b4215d4f8dcf4ffd74d8d1ccb
(cherry picked from commit 12d6fecb7550bdae1e1615bf359849296649c08a)

commit_message:
Allow operator to disable default egress rules

Allow operator to disable default egress rules in order to have
more restrictive security groups that won't allow everything in the
egress direction.   When disabled, responsibility to add all required
flows such as DHCP, DNS, metadata, etc services incumbs to the operator
otherwise VMs will not be automatically configured.   All required
network flows in the egress direction will also be required for all
other services that should be accessible from the VM .

Change-Id: Ibf64570ef3ee76f12b7db0755c5ef1a4a632fc4f

commit_message:
Remove nova-placement

As of train, the placement API was spun out into its own service
and the nova-placement API was removed. This change removes the
nova-placement api from the nova chart since we do not support
releases prior to train.

Change-Id: Ic575150c5d718dbef0d6bafd5197e20f92ec03c3

commit_message:
CI: Avoid image downloads and builds in seed jobs

This change is a combination of previous changes, with some adaptations
for changes in Wallaby:

* Ib59c8bc2d8938eca18c943bb2e66ed185152a739
* If657bf5b0117812d3c53942464cc41cf86cc8ad5

The overall effect is to disable IPA and overcloud host image builds in
seed jobs, since these can be unreliable.

Change-Id: I3c59fa140a89d7d761846cc712e65aa0efda1363

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Allow for unconditional OSD restart

This change allows OSDs to be restarted unconditionally by the
ceph-osd chart. This can be useful in upgrade scenarios where
ceph-osd pods are unhealthy during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I6de98db2b4eb1d76411e1dbffa65c263de3aecee

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 08:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ingress bandwidth limit in the openvswitch agent

For ingress bandwidth limiting openvswitch agent is using QoS and queues
from the Open vSwitch. There is always queue 0 used for that purpose.
Initially, when this feature was implemented, we assumed that queue 0 is
kind of the "default" queue to which all traffic will be send if there
are no other queues. But that's not true thus ingress bandwidth limiting
wasn't working properly with this agent.

This patch fixes that issue but adding in the table=0 of the br-int
additional OF rule to send all traffic to the queue 0.
In this queue for some ports there can be QoS configured
and then it will be applied for the port. If port don't have any QoS
configured, nothing will happen and all will work like before this
patch.

Biggest problem with that solution was the case when also ports with
minimum bandwidth are on the same node becuase such ports are using
different queues (queue number is the same as ofport number of the tap
interface).
In case when traffic is going from the port with minimum bandwidth QoS
to the port which has ingress bw limit configured, traffic is going only
through br-int and will use queue 0 to apply ingress bw limit properly.
In case when traffic from port with minimum bandwidth set needs to go
out from the host, it will always use physical bridge (minimum bandwidth
is only supported for the provider networks) and proper queue will be
set for such traffic in the physical bridge.
To be able to set proper queue in the physical bridge, this patch adds
additional OF rule to the br-int to set queue_num value in the pkt_mark
field [1] as this seems to be only field which can "survive" passing
bridges.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/ovs-fields.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1959567
Change-Id: I1e31565475f38c6ad817268699b165759ac05410
(cherry picked from commit f7ab90baad83823cfb94bc8b9450cd915ea49c03)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ingress bandwidth limit in the openvswitch agent

For ingress bandwidth limiting openvswitch agent is using QoS and queues
from the Open vSwitch. There is always queue 0 used for that purpose.
Initially, when this feature was implemented, we assumed that queue 0 is
kind of the "default" queue to which all traffic will be send if there
are no other queues. But that's not true thus ingress bandwidth limiting
wasn't working properly with this agent.

This patch fixes that issue but adding in the table=0 of the br-int
additional OF rule to send all traffic to the queue 0.
In this queue for some ports there can be QoS configured
and then it will be applied for the port. If port don't have any QoS
configured, nothing will happen and all will work like before this
patch.

Biggest problem with that solution was the case when also ports with
minimum bandwidth are on the same node becuase such ports are using
different queues (queue number is the same as ofport number of the tap
interface).
In case when traffic is going from the port with minimum bandwidth QoS
to the port which has ingress bw limit configured, traffic is going only
through br-int and will use queue 0 to apply ingress bw limit properly.
In case when traffic from port with minimum bandwidth set needs to go
out from the host, it will always use physical bridge (minimum bandwidth
is only supported for the provider networks) and proper queue will be
set for such traffic in the physical bridge.
To be able to set proper queue in the physical bridge, this patch adds
additional OF rule to the br-int to set queue_num value in the pkt_mark
field [1] as this seems to be only field which can "survive" passing
bridges.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/ovs-fields.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1959567
Change-Id: I1e31565475f38c6ad817268699b165759ac05410
(cherry picked from commit f7ab90baad83823cfb94bc8b9450cd915ea49c03)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-06 17:02:56.000000000', 'message': "Add retry mechanisms to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to setup a retry
context.  The context built from those options can later on be
passed to any of the oslo.cache backends that supports pymemcache's
retry mechanisms.

This patch also sets up the retry mechanisms context based on
the configuration option passed via oslo.config and adds it
as an argument to be passed to the selected oslo.cache backend.

This patch is needed to fix a TLS issue on stable branches introduced by
pymemcache (since train), where if a cluster node disappear the client
will fail without retrying to reconnect or to switch to an other node of
the cluster.

Conflicts:
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/_opts.py
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/core.py
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/tests/test_cache.py

Partial-Bug: #1959562
Change-Id: I6c1a4872d7cf19e3a55c676ef4b4200f18e08f2c
(cherry picked from commit 42bf82d5505a0def3d22972d67fde836f5091ed1)

"}]
commit_message:
Add retry mechanisms to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to setup a retry
context.  The context built from those options can later on be
passed to any of the oslo.cache backends that supports pymemcache's
retry mechanisms.

This patch also sets up the retry mechanisms context based on
the configuration option passed via oslo.config and adds it
as an argument to be passed to the selected oslo.cache backend.

This patch is needed to fix a TLS issue on stable branches introduced by
pymemcache (since train), where if a cluster node disappear the client
will fail without retrying to reconnect or to switch to an other node of
the cluster.

Conflicts:
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/_opts.py
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/core.py
    CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in oslo_cache/tests/test_cache.py

Partial-Bug: #1959562
Change-Id: I6c1a4872d7cf19e3a55c676ef4b4200f18e08f2c
(cherry picked from commit 42bf82d5505a0def3d22972d67fde836f5091ed1)
(cherry picked from commit 23e8e9a9f45956ef7ea74d3d443e518f13b43477)
(cherry picked from commit 55b796be5679ffecc64f1940da425cac5c982fc1)
(cherry picked from commit 91f61a50c0a4df70ff7e9c729aa3feda82e59582)
(cherry picked from commit 973616a87323d2d5300d8062e349b6925ece81bd)

commit_message:
Deprecate nova CLI

It is time to signal that we're fully committed to delivering a pure
OSC experience.

Based on the neutron change from 6 (!!) years ago [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/3a64a7a166be25d40436fd40c8351a79267bd3c4

Change-Id: Ib80548e104a751179f36f2a6ebff9916d38fdf1e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-31 08:36:05.000000000', 'message': 'Clean duplicated QoS bandwidth related methods in ovs_lib module

This patch also some helper methods used in the
minimum bandwidth qos methods as it seems that we had things almost
duplicated in methods like _find/update/delete_{qos,queue} and
find/update/delete_{qos,queue}.

It also moves functional tests for the ingress bandwidth limit rules
methods to more appropriate module.

Related-bug: 1959567
Change-Id: I848af01c8fe3a08b26d05e37d225c944ea080f03
(cherry picked from commit 0255f41ad0405eac8b2a4e0870513846e2660f7f)
'}]
commit_message:
Clean duplicated QoS bandwidth related methods in ovs_lib module

This patch also some helper methods used in the
minimum bandwidth qos methods as it seems that we had things almost
duplicated in methods like _find/update/delete_{qos,queue} and
find/update/delete_{qos,queue}.

It also moves functional tests for the ingress bandwidth limit rules
methods to more appropriate module.

Related-bug: 1959567
Change-Id: I848af01c8fe3a08b26d05e37d225c944ea080f03
(cherry picked from commit 0255f41ad0405eac8b2a4e0870513846e2660f7f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-06 15:23:03.000000000', 'message': "Use https instead of git to pull contents from github

Recent github doesn't allow dowonload over git protocol without

commit_message:
Use https instead of git to pull contents from github

Recent github doesn't allow dowonload over git protocol without
authentication. Let's switch to https which is still allowed without
authentication.

Change-Id: I52e1a5407d92ef935ddfbb7f8a9cc32ef9d159cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-22 09:42:34.000000000', 'message': 'Log request IDs for matched Nova external events

Nova notifier logs for external events only provide the event
details without showing its connection to the associated request_id.

That complicates debugging of corner cases for external events as we
cannot be sure to which exact request a logged event is related.

Make the matching request_ids logged alongside external event
details, whenever it is available.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I047a28744a0bf52ace9f9a205993c6037a21083c
(cherry picked from commit 7cedbdeabae6c520dcdd56007d288cd351fb3269)
'}]
commit_message:
Log request IDs for matched Nova external events

Nova notifier logs for external events only provide the event
details without showing its connection to the associated request_id.

That complicates debugging of corner cases for external events as we
cannot be sure to which exact request a logged event is related.

Make the matching request_ids logged alongside external event
details, whenever it is available.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I047a28744a0bf52ace9f9a205993c6037a21083c
(cherry picked from commit 7cedbdeabae6c520dcdd56007d288cd351fb3269)

subject: Fix description of memcache_servers
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-03-18 14:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2022-03-25 15:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2022-04-06 14:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-03-18 14:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix description of memcache_servers

Current description says the option is used by only two backends but
in fact this option is used by all backends dependent on memcached.

Note that the inet6 prefix is specific to the python-memcached library
and should not be used if a backend dependent on different libraries
(eg. pymemcache) is used. This change describes that point, too.

Change-Id: I3c967841c94b9409096c9b9591f9fb162db7a1ac
'}]
commit_message:
Fix description of memcache_servers

Current description says the option is used by only two backends but
in fact this option is used by all backends dependent on memcached.

Note that the inet6 prefix is specific to the python-memcached library
and should not be used if a backend dependent on different libraries
(eg. pymemcache) is used. This change describes that point, too.

Change-Id: I3c967841c94b9409096c9b9591f9fb162db7a1ac

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I8143ca09cafc3bf2ae68c856f426f2acaa699b38

commit_message:
Adds docker daemon config to injected files

This PR adds docker daemon config to injected files when
docker_bridge_network_ip option is defined in trove.conf.

Original problem is that Trove developers unable to transfer files
between GuestVMs and Controller host when controller host address
range is same with docker bridge network one.

Task: 44805
Story: 2009928
Change-Id: I6ad7eb7b2a7fb0686604b69d0175ec0d06f60384

[{'created': '2022-04-05 23:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'Retire openstack-health

openstack-health is QA repo and service to know the
job/test success/failure rate. But for a long (more than
a year), this code is broken. We do not have any maintainer
in QA to fix and maintain it. As it is broken, QA and infra team
agree to stop the service

- http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/

In QA zed PTG, we decided to retire the repo also

- https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-zed-ptg

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/836706
Change-Id: Ie15aa8e469b0bb3aff47dcad422c0676fea640d2
'}]
commit_message:
Retire openstack-health

openstack-health is QA repo and service to know the
job/test success/failure rate. But for a long (more than
a year), this code is broken. We do not have any maintainer
in QA to fix and maintain it. As it is broken, QA and infra team
agree to stop the service

- http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/

In QA zed PTG, we decided to retire the repo also

- https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-zed-ptg

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/836706
Change-Id: Ie15aa8e469b0bb3aff47dcad422c0676fea640d2

commit_message:
Remove create_server and rebuild_server methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
	* create_server
	* rebuild_server

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Ic0cbced04abe6af5d20ff5c461d0304cf5ef475a

commit_message:
Use openstack uri proto

Align aodh role with others and use
openstack_service_<type>uri_proto variables as default ones
to define protocol being used for endpoints.

Change-Id: Idbc68f7496fd57f98fc77b9d0e345e576b51d108

commit_message:
(python-magnumclient) Add openstack coe cluster list --project

We need to be able to list clusters as admin in a project we need to support
project filtering per project.

This is the patch for the client.

Story:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2009909

Change-Id: I746ca8de4ee86afe686d48f9b6df6d52c45a7e17

* Build IPA images

Change-Id: Idecda342f3ab86733e8d59061458d44af834dbb0
'}, {'created': '2022-03-29 14:36:12.000000000', 'message': 'CI: separate image builds into a non-voting job

Adds a non-voting kayobe-seed-images-centos8s job, which does the following:

* Build IPA images
* Build overcloud host images
* Build a base container image

Change-Id: Idecda342f3ab86733e8d59061458d44af834dbb0
'}, {'created': '2022-03-30 09:38:36.000000000', 'message': "CI: separate image builds into a non-voting job

Disk and container image builds tend to be fairly unreliable.
With 3 voting seed jobs all building images, this can introduce
instability into the CI jobs.

This change adds a non-voting kayobe-seed-images-centos8s job, which
does the following:

* Builds IPA images
* Builds an overcloud host image
* Builds a base container image

Similar Rocky and Ubuntu jobs are added to the experimental pipeline,
and may be run by commenting 'check experimental' in gerrit.

The existing kayobe-seed-* jobs no longer build images.

Change-Id: Idecda342f3ab86733e8d59061458d44af834dbb0
"}, {'created': '2022-03-30 11:34:17.000000000', 'message': "CI: separate image builds into a non-voting job

Disk and container image builds tend to be fairly unreliable.
With 3 voting seed jobs all building images, this can introduce
instability into the CI jobs.

This change adds a non-voting kayobe-seed-images-centos8s job, which
does the following:

commit_message:
CI: separate image builds into a non-voting job

Disk and container image builds tend to be fairly unreliable.
With 3 voting seed jobs all building images, this can introduce
instability into the CI jobs.

This change adds a non-voting kayobe-seed-images-centos8s job, which
does the following:

* Builds IPA images
* Builds an overcloud host image
* Builds a base container image

Similar Rocky and Ubuntu jobs are added to the experimental pipeline,
and may be run by commenting 'check experimental' in gerrit.

The existing kayobe-seed-* jobs no longer build images.

Change-Id: Idecda342f3ab86733e8d59061458d44af834dbb0
